text: verb tenses in English lesson 2 simple
present
you just heard Eric my friend and
neighbor play an unusual instrument now

between Eric and me pay attention to our
use of verbs
after you're done listening I'll ask
some questions to check your
understanding

is an instrument from Australia that's

didgeridoo
this is a traditional didgeridoo okay
but then how is your didgeridoo
different from the traditional

what's the difference in sound how does
it sound different this instrument has

right in this instrument this instrument
has many different keys and I can play
all kinds of different notes on
that is way cooler well thank you
let's see how much you remember from the

this is the new
okay which two instruments is the new

that the new is a cross between the

question where does the didgeridoo come

question what makes Eric's chromatic

many keys like a saxophone so let's talk
about the verbs
is is comes has these are all examples
of the simple present why do we use the
simple present in these sentences this
is the new it's a cross between the
didgeridoo and the saxophone it comes
from Australia it has many keys these
are all facts and stating present facts
or general truths is one of the most
common reasons for using the simple
present let's talk about other reasons
now look at these two examples I see
Eric and his family very often I'm very
comfortable when I talk to Eric
the purpose of these statements isn't
really to state a fact or Express a
general truth here I'm explaining an
activity that happens very often I see
Eric and his family very often so we use
the simple present to talk about
repeated activities repeated events that
could be habits or just things that
occur often in the second example I'm
very comfortable how do I feel
comfortable I'm using the simple present
to talk about a feeling a state a
condition when do I have this feeling
when I talk to Eric I'm using the simple
present to refer to the activity of
talking in general so when I talk to him
and when I've talked to him in the past
and probably when I will talk to him in
the future there's this feeling of
comfort of comfortable so for a general
reference to an activity that occurred
in the past occurs still Nell and will
occur in the future we can use this
simple present and we'll use the simple
present for States present state
present conditions and we could also say
for usual states usual conditions
once again we use the simple present to
state facts and general truths present
habits activities and events that happen
frequently or regularly and present or
usual states feelings and conditions
let's also take a moment to review form
as you know the simple present can look
the same as the base form of the verb
but we usually add an S or ES to form
the third-person singular for example I
write you right he writes I teach they
teach she teaches and we add that es
ending when the final consonant sound is
a hissing sound or sound with friction
like the and our final example fly I fly
we fly it flies we change a wide to an
eye when that Y follows a consonant the
Y changes to an i and then we add es
some verbs have irregular forms they
must be learned let's review the present
forms of be do and have I am you are she
he is we are they are I do you do she he
does we do they do I have you have she
he has we have they have
the negative is formed with the helping
verbs don't doesn't plus the base verb
for example I don't like that kind of
music he doesn't play the trumpet short
answers to yes/no questions also use
helping verbs do does for example do you
like loud music yes I do
or no I don't
let's try and exercise because I think
most of you watching this video have a
high level of English we won't focus on
how to form the simple present because I
think you're pretty good at that already
instead we'll focus on when and why we
use this verb tense
practice identify the reason for using
the simple present I'll show you a
statement you tell me the reason
one the school always has a holiday
concert in December why do we use the
simple present the concert is a regular
event
to a piano has 88 keys why do we use the
simple present because this is a fact
three Lukas is happiest when he plays
the guitar what are the reasons for
using the simple present here
well Lukas is happiest that expresses a
feeling estate when he plays the guitar
that refers to an activity that happens
frequently or regularly
for a cello player sits to play why do
we use the simple present here this
refers to a truth a fact
five Gwen wears the same necklace at
every performance for good luck why do
we use the simple present here we're
talking about her habit
well that's all for this lesson thanks
for joining me I hope you'll continue to
